conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C, and we need to predict which container D, E, or F it will flow into after passing through baffles.
Point A is located at the top center of the image, above an orange opening. Below A, there is a purple baffle angled to the left.
Liquid flows downward from A and encounters the purple baffle, which directs the flow leftward.
The liquid from A continues straight into Container D.
Point B is located at the top center of the image, above a blue opening. Below B, there is a green baffle angled to the right.
Liquid flows downward from B and encounters the green baffle, which directs the flow rightward.
The liquid from B continues straight into Container E.
Point C is located at the top center of the image, above a white opening. Below C, there is a brown baffle angled to the left.
Liquid flows downward from C and encounters the brown baffle, which directs the flow leftward.
The liquid from C continues straight into Container F.
Liquid from A flows into Container D, liquid from B flows into Container E, and liquid from C flows into Container F.
